rules: Rule1: If the restaurant has authorization to receive the food shipment, then food is delivered to the restaurant.
Rule2: If the vehicle has valid transport authorization, then either the food shipment has emergency approval or, should the food shipment pass lab testing, the food shipment meets safety standards.
Rule3: If a delivery truck has a scheduled delivery event, then the delivery truck has a confirmed delivery event.
Rule4: If a delivery truck has a confirmed delivery event, then the restaurant has authorization to receive the food shipment.
Rule5: If the food shipment passes inspection, then the restaurant has authorization to receive the food shipment.
Rule6: If the food shipment meets safety standards, then the food shipment does not have contamination.
Rule7: Either the food shipment passes lab testing or the food shipment passes visual inspection.
Rule8: If the food shipment passes visual inspection, then the food shipment meets safety standards.
Rule9: If the food supplier meets requirements, then the vehicle has valid transport authorization.
Rule10: Either the food supplier meets requirements or the food distributor meets requirements.
Rule11: If the food distributor meets requirements, then either the food shipment has emergency approval or, should the food shipment pass lab testing, the food shipment meets safety standards.
Rule12: If food is not delivered to the restaurant, then the food shipment has contamination.
facts: Fact1: A delivery truck has a scheduled delivery event.
Fact2: The food shipment passes inspection.
Fact3: The food shipment does not have emergency approval.

question: Food is delivered to the restaurant.
